title: The Genius Owala Water Bottle Trick We Wish We'd Known About Sooner
description: A better, colder way to stay hydrated.
content:
The Genius Owala Water Bottle Trick We Wish We'd Known About Sooner originally appeared on Parade.

Every now and then a new water bottle reigns supreme among the hydrated girls and boys, and lately, the crown belongs to the Owala FreeSip Bottle. If you don't own one yourself, you've likely seen them around.

What Is the Owala Water Bottle?

The smooth-topped, insulated, leak-proof water bottle comes in a slew of bright or muted pastel color block designs. What's special about this bottle is the combination lid, which features a mouth spout in addition to a built-in removable sip straw, allowing for a very personalized water-drinking experience.

As someone who recently joined the Owala water bottle hive, I have to say this bottle is quite state-of-the-art. I get to cater to my hydration needs at any given moment—if I need to guzzle, I use the spout, and if I'm in the middle of a treadmill run and need water fast, I sip through the straw.

The only issue with the straw? The material of the straw itself—it's plastic. Before you freak out that you shelled out money on an Owala, fear not. What if we told you there was an easy, affordable way to sip water from your Owala?

Related: How To Tell if You Aren't Drinking Enough Water

What Is the Owala Water Bottle Trick?

Straw company Koala Straws recently took to TikTok to share a way to replace the plastic straw that comes with your Owala bottle with a metal straw. This clever swap means you won't expose your water (or yourself) to plastics, and your water will taste colder. When you're parched, what more could you ask for?

How to Install a Metal Water Bottle in Your Owala Water Bottle

First, measure the dimensions of your Owala straw and search online or in stores for a metal straw of an identical size. Koala Straws sells metal straws that are custom-made to fit various sizes of Owala bottles. Open your Owala, unscrew the plastic straw, and insert the metal straw. Close and use your bottle as normal.

Related: Best Bottled Water to Drink, Ranked by The Water Sommelier

Other Ways to Take Care of Your Owala Water Bottle

1. Clean the spout gasket. This is the grey piece of silicone attached to the inside of the lid. You can use a sponge or dishcloth to clean the crevices where mold can grow.

2. Give it a deep clean. Hand washing is fine most of the time, but every so often, run the lid and cup through the dishwasher.

3. Pay special attention to the straw. Water bottle straws can get a little funky, so be sure to run a straw cleaner through yours regularly to make sure it's sparkly clean.

Related: We Tried the Viral All-Natural Way to Keep Flies From Bugging You Outside to See If It's Worth the Hype

Popular Questions
Do Owala FreeSip® water bottles contain lead?
Owala Bottles Are Lead Free. Always Have Been. Always Will Be.
There’s been a lot of media buzz about bottle safety. We’re here to reassure you that we’ve always been committed to consumer safety because all Owala bottles and tumblers—including the award-winning Owala FreeSip® water bottle—are and always have been lead free.
True to our goal of challenging the norm, we’ve used innovative, lead-free solder in our products from the very beginning—just one example of our commitment to prioritize your safety and well-being above all else.
Can I put other beverages in my FreeSip® water bottle besides water?
The Stainless Steel FreeSip® water bottle shouldn’t be used with hot, carbonated, or perishable liquids. So just stick to water and hit that daily quota.
If you’re set on having hot or carbonated beverages, check out our tumbler products.For further instructions and warnings when using hot or carbonated beverages please see individual product care guides.
Are Owala FreeSip® water bottles dishwasher safe?
Stainless Steel
The lids are top-rack dishwasher safe and the straws can go in the silverware bin. While the cups are also technically dishwasher safe as well, we strongly recommend you hand-wash them to maintain that beautiful finish.
Eastman Tritan™ Plastic
All parts are top-rack dishwasher safe. Just throw them in and get back to relaxing.
